definition: to concentrate entirely on sth/fully engaged/with full force
secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: They devoted all their energies to the job.
sentences.chinese: 他們把全副精力投入這項工作。

sentences.english: She devoted all her energy to the job.
sentences.chinese: 他把全副精力投入這項工作。

sentences.english: We must bring all our energy to bear upon the task.
sentences.chinese: 我們應把全副精力用於此項工作上。

definition: to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to banish from one's thoughts/to ignore/to take no notice
